title: Christine Lagarde - Wikipedia
snippet: Christine Madeleine Odette Lagarde (French: [kʁistin madlɛn ɔdɛt laɡaʁd]; née Lallouette, IPA: [lalwɛt]; born 1 January 1956) is a French politician and lawyer who has been the President of the European Central Bank since 2019. She previously served as the 11th Managing Director of ...

title: Christine Lagarde Biography for Kids
snippet: She was married to Wilfried Lagarde from 1982 to1992 and bore two kids Thomas and Pierre-Henri, and then divorced later married to Eachran Gilmour and divorced. Christine was appointed the first female to head the Ministry of Finance, Economy ...

title: Christine Lagarde Family History & Historical Records - MyHeritage
snippet: Christine GAUDIN (born LAGARDE) was born in 1697. ... Christine married Julien GAUDIN on month day 1718, at age 21 in marriage place.

title: Christine Lagarde
snippet: Lagarde has been involved in three significant long-term relationships, with varying marital outcomes. Her first confirmed marriage was to French financial analyst Wilfried Lagarde in 1982, which ultimately ended in divorce in 1992.

title: Christine Lagarde | Biography, IMF, ECB, & Facts | Britannica
snippet: She was made a partner in 1987 and became the first female member (1995–99) of the executive committee. She was made chairman of the executive committee in 1999 (reelected 2002) and moved to Chicago.
